Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Italiana58
Reviews.Content: If you're driving, this hotel has reasonably priced valet parking for L.A. Best of all, it's access in and out is excellent since the entrance is on Olympic rather than one of the busier streets like Wilshire or Santa Monica. The valet staff was also very fast and we literally never waited more than a couple minutes for our car, even at 5:00 a.m. I've read that this hotel was renovated which I find surprising because the hallways are very unattractive for a Marriott. The rooms are standardly decorated, but spotlessly clean (a major requirement for me). Our bathroom was very tiny, only fitting the toilet and shower. The sink is located outside of the bathroom. We had a king sized bed which came with three very small pillows. Larger pillows would have been more comfortable, but in all fairness, I never asked for extras and the staff was so accommodating, I have no doubt they would have responded to such a request. A great plus is free in-room WiFi which is something surprisingly unusual. Overall it's a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: mdcutie01
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about staying here by some of the reviews I read at first. But I noticed the reviews only seemed to be bad around the renovation time, so since they were over I decided to give this hotel a try. Plus they have great goverment rates! And I'm glad I did. The hotel staff, valet, bar/resturant staff, everyone was very professional and very nice. Any questions asked, someone had an answer and were willing to help. The rooms were very clean, which is a biggie for me. I have a bit of an OCD problem when it comes to cleaness! The location was good as well. If you are looking to just be able to walk to places though, this is not the place for you. The closest attraction is the mall, which is about a 15 minute walk. You will need a rental car if you stay here. Downtown LA is about 25 minutes away. But you are close to Rodeo drive. Only about a 10 minute drive. I liked it because it is in Beverly Hills and you are out of the way of all the madness that goes on in Hollywood when it's time to go to bed! I will aboslutely be back. I honestly have nothing negative to say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: tianapat
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Great staff, James was especially amazing. Love the renovation!

Reviews.Title: “Great even for a an emergency stay!”
Reviews.Author: ypebbles
Reviews.Content: We called about five different places, this one by far was a great choice. NoRegrets what so ever. Comfortable and very pleasant all around. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cedars Sinai Medical Center”
Reviews.Author: Star1988
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Marriott, Century City/Beverly Hills location. It was really nice. My stay was enjoyable. I recommend this hotel to anyone who needs a quick place to stay at a moments notice. I'm coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Deanna D
Reviews.Content: Marriott Courtyard in LA on Olympic was excellent. Staff was so attentive and pleasant. Rooms were meticulously cleaned, free continental breakfast was great and having a a free business computer pod area was an unexpected but welcomed surprise! We'll be back and thanks for such great service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Thor G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an overnight weekend with my out of town friends. I originally booked at the Plaza Bevery Hills but my friends couldn't get reservations there as they are already fully book. So I cancelled my reservation there and booked here. I was surprised how the Plaza Hotel and this little Marriott hotel have pretty much the same price. I would probably prefer to stay at the Plaza but I'm still glad I booked here as I personally did not have issues on this hotel. In fact, I actually had a pleasant stay. My room was perfect for me. It was roomy, smells and feels clean. My sheets and my king size bed were comfortable. Most importantly, my room was very quiet. My first time to sleep 7 hours straight since my son was born. So yea, this deserve a 4 stars in my book. By all means, this hotel is more of a 3 stars hotel but pleasant stay and good night sleep is priceless. Timmy the valet guy was also very pleasant and helpful. Marco, the front desk was accommodating to me. He seems apologetic for my friends plight when I told him about their issues, which he also tried to amend. But hey, that's their issues = their review :-)

Reviews.Title: “It is a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Magbos
Reviews.Content: The worst is that we see bugs in bed. used dishes piled up and fell on the floor in the breakfast room without being cleaned up, location is far from transportation, condition is well below 3.5 star standard as claimed, and it is really over priced as the way it is.

Reviews.Title: “worst Marriott we've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: bartwig
Reviews.Content: This hotel was filthy. Finger print and sticky stuff on every switch plate. No mattress pad on bed. Hallways dirty. The elevator stuck and the manager later told us that never happened. Never again..

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend. Hard to tell what the hotel will be like after the renovation but it was just ok.”
Reviews.Author: Esther S
Reviews.Content: Beds were comfortable but with an address boasting Beverly Hills that is what you would expect. It was close to Rodeo Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard Marriott Century City/Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: RaylaSmith
Reviews.Content: We were not informed that there was extensive renovation underway. Before leaving for LA we made arrangements to meet friends in the lobby. When we arrived we learned that there is not lobby. The arrangements that were made to minimize the impact of the renovations on our stay, required us to continually tip people. There was no reduction in the price. We were given breakfast in two rooms from which the furniture had been removed. There was dust everywhere. In short, the stay was exceedingly unpleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard Century City LA”
Reviews.Author: mwstaudt
Reviews.Content: I understand that the lobby in under repair and have dealt with those type of conditions previously. As a long time Marriott customer, I seek Courtyards be design due t the fact that with my Platinum status I have the opportunity for upgrades and, most importantly, for the money they cannot be beat. That was until my recent trip to Los Angeles. Yes, the lobby is under repair and everything is a bit chaotic. You have to go down hallways and up stairs to get to the room elevators and that is all understandable. What is less understandable - especially given the circumstances is that the other aspects of the hotel come up way short as well. The room was dated and small - an oddity in all of the Courtyard rooms I have been in over the last 12 years. The breakfast area was set up in a room due to the lobby being closed (understandable) but the normal items were not to be found. No eggs, no water, no yogurt, no milk, no tomato juice, etc. Then, when going to print out my boarding pass for the flight out of LAX, the first printer was out of ink and the pass came out illegible. I had to locate another location (found be accident) to produce a clean output. Last, when I had the bill left under the door the next morning, it too was illegible - must have been printed out on the same printer I first used for the boarding pass. The attention to detail is severely lacking and this is at a time that is should be at it's highest. Plus you get all of this for over $200 per night. I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price.... near Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: Johnny007
Reviews.Content: We were in L.A. from Dallas for my wife's medical tests at Cedars-Sinai Hospital. We decided not to rent a car for the week, partly because of the $20 daily parking fee at the hotel and partly because we would not be doing any extracirricular activities. Due to construction in the lobby, the normal in and out of the hotel was somewhat inconvenient. Check-in was a makeshift lobby just off the garage. Then you walk down one flight of stairs to another "lobby" where you catch the elevator to your floor. The staff was extremely helpful to us - each time my wife and I arrived or departed, they sent a driver with a golf cart to the lower lobby to bring us to the upper lobby. They also provided a wheelchair so my wife could more easily get from the elevator to our room. Since we had opted not to rent a car, we needed a taxi to the hospital each day for three days. The hotel staff referred us to a limo service (Turbo Limos - Mr. Harry Kim)that took us back and forth for less than the cost of a taxi (confimed, as we did use a taxi once). Harry also drove us to the airport to go home for a lower price than we had paid another limo the day we arrived. I highly recommend the limo service. The location is good as far as being on a main artery. If you don't have your own transportation, it is not so hot for stuff nearby (i.e. restaurants). There is a nice supermarket across the street, though. No swimming pool, but there is a whirlpool and an indoor-outdoor gym with some nice cardio machines, a bench, and a full rack of dumbbells.

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay at the last minute...”
Reviews.Author: evad5
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Courtyard Marriott. We were given, along with others, a great rate for the area. We asked for a quiet room and were accommodated. Although I was given a "quiet" room, there was a constant hum from the air conditioning (not in my room), music playing, or noise from the jacuzzi and guests. I am incredibly sensitive to noise. All of the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. They are going through renovations so there was a little confusion regarding breakfast, their lobby and initial greetings. The continental breakfast was served in a small room with very little seating. I was advised that the hotel was under renovation. If you want a place to sleep, this hotel is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price for the location + simple good gym”
Reviews.Author: Cliveirl
Reviews.Content: Despite remodelling works, the hotel was simple and pleasant to visit. Rooms facing road were a little noisy - ask for rear facing room. Staff were friendly and complimentary breakfast / wifi made the stay good value given the location.

Reviews.Title: “find out about the construction going on before committing”
Reviews.Author: tfwillyb
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for my stay, however, I did not find out about the construction at the hotel until a few days before my scheduled arrival. Would have liked to have know this earlier and what it entailed. Nevertheless, I will say that the hotel staff was very friendly, accommodating and countless times reminded me how much they appreciated my business. The room was a bit dated but typical Courtyard fare. The renovations to the main floor should certainly add some pizzaz to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany F
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was under construction, we received teh best customer service and you can't beat a free breakfast. The locale of the hotel was perfect! --Tiffany

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service!”
Reviews.Author: Kidlet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Century City for business. I have to admit I was a little bummed when I arrived that the lobby was under construction. And..it is an older property with small but updated rooms. But..the staff more than made up for it! The valets were particularly helpful with a greeting and smile and excellent directions and help. The lobby will be done soon and I look forward to staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Decent Rooms”
Reviews.Author: macsima
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently on business. Good location with easy access to Santa Monica, Beverly Hills and Century City. Rooms are fine. Valet parking on site.

Reviews.Title: “Real disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Toni N Arlene W
Reviews.Content: We love Marriott and this location was a real disappointment. The first thing was I prepaid for the room and wasn't notified until afterwards that the hotel was going thru a MAJOR remodeling. It was very inconvienant to get to the rooms, the breakfast area was small and crowded, the fire alarm went off EARLY Sunday AM, the maid came around erly and their radios were lound so we had no choice but to wake up early on a Sunday AM, after being out all Saturday night. Our room had a horrible smell to it, old and musty. We went to Ralphs and got a candle. We will never stay at this location again. My wife and I thinkwe will take a break from Marrioit for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Construction woes - good staff”
Reviews.Author: Daylily146
Reviews.Content: The construction is a nuisance but the staff is courteous and anxious to make it as convenient as possible. **Not for those who can't negotiate steps easily** The room was small (as is usually the case in LA) but comfortable and clean. Unfortunately, not much thought was put into the heavy electrical needs for the room used for the breakfast - the power went out every time someone tried to make a waffle and the fire alarm went off along with fire trucks arriving on scene (good to know they took it seriously) but we didn't bother with the breakfast the second morning and opted to go out instead.... Since family lives nearby, we'll likely still use this hotel on future visits, but we'll hope the construction is finished before our next trip. It was an adventure but not altogether unpleasant. While the only option with a car is the valet at an extra $17 a day (not out of line for LA) we spent a lot more on constant tips as we went in and out several times a day. To offset that cost at least the internet is free and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Poor experiance - nice staff”
Reviews.Author: AllanKalamazoo
Reviews.Content: My room was old and worn. I didn't feel comfortable walking on the carpet without shoes. The floor has divots hidden by the old carpet. The property is under construction which did not help but they are renovating the wrong thing; the rooms need to be upgraded, not the lobby. As Mingo05 mentioned, an email was sent prior to my arrival but it had zero mention of "Marriott" or "Courtyard" or dates of my stay; I figured it might be legit but so does everyone else who gets a phising scheme they fall for, so I played it safe and deleted it. Which raises a question; they take the time to send an email, why can't they better identify themselves or the property? Perhaps they want to cover their tails by sending an email but make it vague enough so people don't cancel and book another hotel? Not saying this is the case but it fits the circumstances. As the title says, the staff was quite nice; I would love to see what they could do when they have a company behind them which support$$ them with a good property. Positives: Hot tub worked, exercise equipment worked Negatives: Not enough parking, breakfast was poor, trash throughout the property not picked up, rooms outdated, air conditioners in rooms too noisy, jury rigged security bars on balcony windows, dirty carpets, limited TV channels, only one place within walking distance for food (Ralph's supermarket across the street). Negative: I spoke with a nice clerk sharing my perception of this stay (I have stayed at 15-20 Courtyards across the country, this is the worst) he was receptive and documented it well. Then I get a form letter email reply from the General Manager. This was not a question or issue regarding 'Remodeling' but sending the one pre-formed email was all time this one manager was going to invest in my issue. To send a email about "Topic "B"" when the discussion was about "Topic "A"", is disrespectful. I would love to get a list of all hotels Pacific Host manages; (parent company), I would try one more property as a 'last chance' and see what happens. If your expectations are low and you don't plan on being in your room for more than an hour a day, then this will meet needs but if you like feeling as if you are getting value for your money, I would recommend someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Well managed, good location, but otherwise average”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeRex
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on business. While the construction is potentially a real negative for guests, the management has taken a progressive approach to alleviating its effects. Check in at the temporary lobby location was fast and friendly. My room was comfortable and clean. The complementary breakfast was good enough to start a business day with and I was able to take mine back to the room and enjoy it on the balcony. There is a small but pleasantly situated outdoor gym (three treadmills and some free weights). Internet was fast and free (the latter, perhaps because of the construction) The location is excellent, minutes from the heart of Century City, Beverly Hills and Westwood/UCLA. Now for the demerits, if you are a light sleeper, the air conditioning in the room is pretty noisy. On top of that, the walls and floors are thin and noise from other guest rooms can be quite intrusive. Finally, self or valet parking is $17/day which while probably reasonable for the location adds to your bottom line.

Reviews.Title: “Construction woes.”
Reviews.Author: Mingo05
Reviews.Content: I reserved a 3 night stay at this hotel based in part on the good reviews I read. To the hotel's credit, I received an e-mail in advance of my travel telling me the hotel would be starting a lobby/restaurant renovation the week I was there, but that it would not affect my room. I arrived during lobby demolition and could not hear to check in. The room was okay but hardly worth the $229/night I paid. It was small and had an odor like old paint. The carpet was dirty and stained. There was a long black hair wrapped in the hair dryer's cord. There was something in the room that triggered my allergies. When I walked to dinner, the elevator to the lobby floor had been closed. I had to go to the lower level, walk into the basement of the parking facility, find the stairs and walk up (after I found them) to the new temporary lobby. It was inconvenient and a bit creepy for a woman traveling alone. The next morning I called the front desk to tell them I was leaving early. When I checked out, they didn't ask how things were or why I was leaving. I found a fabulous hotel nearby for $50 less per night. This hotel may be fine after the lobby renovation is complete, but because of the issues with the room, I won't be returning. On a positive note, the valet service was fast and super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, positive experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mamur
Reviews.Content: The price was high compared to other courtyard marriott's, but it is reasonable for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: Pete H
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel with easy access to UCLA (daughter is an incoming freshman and we are from out of state). Hotel is 10 min. from campus and an easy drive. Staff is very helpful and professional, rooms are clean, Ralph's supermarket across the street is great for stocking the fridge in the room. I'm a runner and the hotel is 3 min. from a big park that makes for a nice 3 to 5 mile run (pass Fox Studios at one point, a real thrill for a person from the midwest). Exersize room is open air behind the hotel with high quality treadmills and stair machines. Full dumbell set too. Free coffee in the mornings in the lobby Two stays so far and another coming up the end of the month.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Fast and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: SDCooper
Reviews.Content: The staff was great - they were able to provide recommendations for meals, help arrange transportataion and provide directions. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for LA Visit”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are narrower than your average Courtyard they are big enough. My king room came with a sofa and small balcony with a table and two chairs. The property is on a small lot, so don't expect to be lounging by the pool in the SoCal sun. All they have is a small spa to ease sore muscles after a day in the city or a workout in their rather nice fitness room. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff was very friendly. All this coupled with the hotel being located conveniently on Olympic, one of the faster streets to cut across town, I would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: veronicaindonesia
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient. Room is the usual Courtyard standard. Service is good. Easy check in .

Reviews.Title: “The stary of our Marriott stay! Got everything, near enough to everything else! Remember: BOOK EARLY to get good rates!”
Reviews.Author: HardBedVeteran
Reviews.Content: As we were arriving late in the evening it was a good thing that this hotel is relatively easy to find and is on a main road. They have a parking valet charged service which i think is very worth it - and is the only option really. We here checked in very quickly and efficiently and quickly went to rooms. The rooms were quite roomy (by Asian standards) but the bathroom was a little small - however, the room amenities were top-notch, very clean, well decorated (and I think the rooms had just been renovated - if they weren't, then the hotel really has a very very good maintenance team!) The Marriott have a digital entertainment system that has pretty much everything to keep you occupied for at least 4 weeks inside the hotel - so check out their PPV movies, music and more if you plan to be in your rooms to chill out/relax (business travelers take note!). There was a small but adequate gym on the breakfast level (located on the terrace) - please make sure to bring your own bottled water if you want to drink while working out. No multi-weights machine but there is a cross/step trainer, treadmill and sitting bike machine and free weights. Breakfast was not included in our room rate - but it was also very substantial. Breakfast buffet offering (with a wonderful little automated waffle maker) gave you "eggs-made-your-way" option so a great way to start your long touring day schedule! In hotel ministore is really for "can't-be-fussed-to-leave-property-to-buy-beer-and-snacks" situation. Do come prepared. Overall a wonderful property with very friendly, efficient staff all-around! Many thanks to the team there for the hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “average!”
Reviews.Author: benyo3
Reviews.Content: The location is good and the hotel is family's friendly- these are the 2 good things we can say. We arrived Saturday night at around midnight. The room was not ready for 5 people; in spite of the fact we called earlier to make sure it will be ready for 5! They run out of linen. The man from the reception was unwilling to assist us, the security guy notice our frustration and went to the laundry room by himself and helped us! The breakfast hall is old and the furniture are not clean. The dryer wasn't working properly which was a problem for the families who arrived one by another to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JemaiAnne
Reviews.Content: This property is conveniently located if you want to go around downtown LA. It's quite small compared to all the Marriott-brand hotels we go to, but it is cozy and neat. My favorite is the valet service, they were quick and courteous, made us feel very welcome right from the start. Also it was a treat at $17 ( compared to $30 in other big cities).

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: elizabethejs
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Courtyard Century City was wonderful. Excellent service and great rate for being right in the center of everything Los Angeles has to offer. We were in LA for pleasure, and without prior knowledge of the lay of the land, we quickly realized we were in the center of it all! Great for families who need a place to crash and who aren't looking for Hollywood luxury. The hotel and room were clean and the staff extremely friendly and accommodating. One thing to note-- there is no self-parking and valet is $17/day. The other option is to park across the street at the Ralph's grocery store parking garage, but we didn't do that so I'm not sure if there is a cost.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: BassamSadik
Reviews.Content: The hotel is bad and especially the front desk employees I will never go there again

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Marriott experience”
Reviews.Author: Jwieczerzak
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not up to normal Marriott standards. It was a bit run down and had an awkward feeling to it. The location was bad and not near anything. They had very limited special perks for Marriot Gold card members - ytou usually get free breakfast or something like that. A bottle of water and a bag of peanuts were in the room. Breakfast was a bit expensive given the items on the buffet and it openned at 6:30am each morning - a bit late for me. Overall, I would pick another Marriot to stay in...

Reviews.Title: “It is one of the better Courtyard's I have stayed at - will stay again for vacation”
Reviews.Author: billmgay
Reviews.Content: The people were friendly â€“ was able to get a cab every day with ease and the facilities were very nice. Excellent bed and clean room. The location seems to be in the middle between downtown and Beverly Hills â€“ about 30 minutes from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: Brian P
Reviews.Content: Disappointed. I'm a platinum member and stay at Marriott properties often. This one needs a refresh. Valet staff was super friendly, desk staff was ok. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: kinto1
Reviews.Content: I travelled on business and stayed here. The location was good, easy to get to and the staff was friendly and helpful. I found the rooms to be a little small but nicely decorated. I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Century City”
Reviews.Author: Jeffnudi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Courtyard Century City / Beverly Hills several times in the past few years, and will continue to do so when i am in Century City for business. The staff is always friendly and helpful. I run in the morning, and this is a great neighborhood in which to run. I have never worried about my security, and there is enough elevation change to make the runs a bit of work.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and wil use again !!”
Reviews.Author: dementeddentist
Reviews.Content: Great location and well cared for hotel-only deficiency was no coffee in the lobby on Sunday morning when I really needed some fresh brewed coffee-front desk staff sent me upstairs to the breakfast buffet area to retrieve that needed fix !Otherweise great stay !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, facility and staff”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Cz
Reviews.Content: Last November we were in LA and spent about a week at this hotel. From the valet parking guys, to the front desk to the waitress in restaurant, we found everyone wonderfully welcoming, accommodating and helpful.It was our first time back in the US after a 4 year hiatus and felt very much that the attitude (from distant memories) had shifted significantly to the better. While there are plenty of hotel choices in LA; this is our favorite place to land--easy parking, grocery store across the street if you need it (and with kids who doesn't) and easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel that I would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: davidintx
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. The hotel has valet parking which has its good and bad points. But the valets were extremely helpful and courteous. We were on a family vacation (4 of us) and the room was a little small but not unpleasant. The beds were comfortable and the room decor was very nice. The hotel was clean and well taken care of. Not many restaurants or shops immediately around the hotel but there are plenty within a few miles. I would stay here again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: calgrlzl
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised with our stay. The hotel staff was always pleasant and eager to please. My nine year old daughter loved the special attention they showed her and made her truly feel like a star.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel is decent location”
Reviews.Author: jhammil
Reviews.Content: Courtyard Marriotts are awesome. This was the bottom rung of Courtyard Marriotts we have stayed at but still nice. The hotel seems older and maybe in need of some updates. All in all the rooms are clean and nice. However you do have to pay $20/night parking. So you need to factor that in to the cost of booking this hotel. That made it not as great of value as we initially thought that we got through priceline. The fact that there was only valet parking is annoying because I felt the need to tip the guy everytime we went to our car.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location; Perfect Price”
Reviews.Author: JollyHenceforth
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here during our visit to Los Angeles last week. This hotel is in the perfect location: short drive to Santa Monica Pier and Venice Beach; short drive to Beverly Hills and Hollywood; short drive to UCLA and downtown Los Angeles; and a short drive to either LAX or Bob Hope Airport. Our room was reasonably priced and was large enough that we were comfortable. The staff was nice and attentive. Of course there are more luxurious accomodations, but those come with a much more expensive price. We will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definetely recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JohnTerraBella_CA
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation here after doing much research on the internet & trip advisor, since we are not familiar with the LA area, because we were looking for a relatively inexpensive hotel near Cedar-Sinai Hospital. We got a very good rate using the senior discount. Hotel itself is easy to get to & the parking is only $17/day compared to $29/day at several of the other hotels I had looked at. The parking attendant, valet & front desk staff very welcoming and friendly. Pleasantly surprised with our room, it was large and clean. Even with room looking over street, we didn't hear any road noise with the sliding glass door closed. Ralphs grocery store right across the street came in handy and there is a fridge & micro in the room. The resturaunt & bar area were very nice & the staff were so friendly & professional. We would definitely stay here again if we are in this area & will definetely recommend this hotel to friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Fair Price for a hotel in its class”
Reviews.Author: Gaucho100K
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is a good option for moderately priced hotels in the Century City area. Rooms are not very large but the property is fairly new and well maintained. The common areas are not huge and not especially attractive, but they are still above average. The breakfast service is very good and is well above the quality of most other hotel in its class. I would come back here without hesitations.

Reviews.Title: “the opposite of what a Beverly Hills hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: LilyMaPharm
Reviews.Content: I luckily stayed only one night at this hotel. First off, we got a room at the end of the hallway so you could hear all the doors slamming and people walking in the halls. In the room itself, it just smelled so wrong, musty and dusty, which made the towels and the sheets smell the same exact way. The bathroom was a bit dirty with weird stains on the bathtub, shower curtain, toilet, walls, and the door. Although I know people walk into the hotel with their shoes on but I thought maybe seeing as we guests do, there should be carpet cleaning involved because there are odd brown/black stains. Plus the cleaning ladies kept bothering us! Even though there was a sign, they came at 7 in the morning, then 9, then 15 minutes continuing until we decided to just check out early since they were getting on our nerves. The internet connection sucked by the way, it kept kicking us off, then it would take forever to connect.. The $17 parking fee is also ridiculous!!! Overall the experience was bad!! You would think that since it is in Beverly Hills it must be clean and elegant... but no! The room was just gross!

Reviews.Title: “Overall pleased with hotel and would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jwillim
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation here at the last minute (the morning of our arrival) because we were looking for a relatively inexpensive hotel near UCLA. This hotel offers UCLA discount on room rate, but we got a slightly better rate with AAA. Hotel itself is easy to get to, but be aware the only parking is an underground garage for $17/day (street parking nonexistent unless you walk a little ways). We were worried that due to the height limit on the garage we would not be able to get our truck in, but the parking attendant was very helpful and we were able to get parked & checked in. Front desk staff very welcoming and friendly. Pleasantly surprised with our room, it was large and clean. Even with room looking over street, I didn't hear any road noise with the sliding glass door closed. Ralphs grocery store right across the street came in handy and there was a fridge & micro in our room. AM checkout was super easy & fast, and front desk clerk gave us perfect directions to UCLA (better than mapquest & gps). We would definitely stay here again if we are in this area.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Jlj22312
Reviews.Content: Hotel and room were clean. Staff was friendly. Food from room service was tasty. Location was convenient. Price was reasonable. I have no complaints at all. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: puckpimp
Reviews.Content: -Very convenient location -Not worth 280 a night with parking. For that amount, it should be a full scale Marriott -Basic Courtyard room -Free wireless was very slow

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad location or hotel...”
Reviews.Author: LarBearSSF-CA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great deal, which is why we stayed here. It also played into the time/location we'd be in while visiting and seeing LA. We've been through many times, but wanted to do the touristy thing. It was a nice hotel, but it was just a place to lay our heads. We didn't use the facilities at all unfortunately, otherwise, i think they would have been nice. The fee for parking and for laundry is kind of ridiculous considering how much they charge to stay there. I could understand a small fee, but not as much as they do for parking. The free internet was a relief, considering the Manhattan Beach Marriott has no free internet, parking, or laundry. Overall, nice stay, and the fridge in the room was a good perk!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: Hardy009
Reviews.Content: The room was great, comfortable and clean. Our only negative critque is we woke up to a parking ticket! The person who chekced us in didn't warn or educate that parking on the street would be so costly. We are taking this up with the City of LA. There was NO sign saying no parking on our side of the street. Anyway, it would have been nice to have a warning or explaintion to customers that there is a chance of getting a ticket or how the street system works on parking. This will be gratefully appreciated by new customers to the area!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, but ask for room away from street.”
Reviews.Author: Memeoffour
Reviews.Content: We travel frequently and rarely pay this much to stay in a hotel, but to be assured that we could stay in the same hotel as our grandchildren, who were also staying at this location with their parents, we opted to pay the price. Even though it was not inexpensive, it was worth the $. Our room was lovely and quiet. The staff was great from the parking attendants to the front desk, to the breakfast servers. All were gracious and helpful. My only issue was with our daughter's room. They had a corner suite that faced Olympic Blvd. It was quite noisy as we were babysitting the children in their room for a few hours and would havve had difficulty sleeping had it been our room.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for anything more...”
Reviews.Author: LeighBC
Reviews.Content: I was in the area for business and this hotel was perfect for my needs. The room was spacious and clean, the front desk and valet staff were nice, responsive and professional and the hotel was in a great location. To anyone that had a problem, with this hotel, I cannot imagine why. Love the complimentary fruit in the lobby in the afternoon - after my very long flight to the west coast it was a welcome pick-me-up as I arrived. Also, they had my favorite soda in their little shop and that made me not have to go across the street to Ralph's (although I wouldn't have minded). There's no pool but the whirlpool was hot and helped relax my back after two days of meetings. It's in a great location and the staff were very helpful with directions and suggestions. Other than a free breakfast, there is nothing else this hotel could have done for me. And I'm not asking for a free breakfast :) I had hot tea in the room (good tea!) and that was great. There are microwaves and refrigerators in the rooms, as well. Will stay here again when I am in LA for business.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: MrKite58
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a reasonably priced hotel in the Beverly Hills area. Not being familiar at all with the area, we picked the Courtyard based on the Marriot name and the many positive reviews. We were absolutely thrilled with our choice. The hotel is very clean, tastefully decorated, and every staff member we came in contact with was friendly, helpful and efficient. The valet guys were awesome, offering sightseeing and dining recommendations. Oh, and not to be overlooked, the bed was one of the most comfortable we've ever slept in at a hotel. The location was perfect, a short 10 minute drive go Rodeo Drive, about 20 minutes to Hollywood, and about 30 minutes or so to the beaches. Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for outstanding service, clean comfortable rooms, and easy access to major attractions. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: garygaines
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the accommodations during my stay in San Francisco... Your staff was very friendly, helpful and pleasent.... Would visit this location again.... Bar Staff was not as friendly.... Front desk staff and night luggage porter were outstanding.,

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: GriswaldFlorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel is short on frills, but I had a pleasant stay here for a biz trip. The staff are very friendly, rooms and common areas are very clean. I would note that there's really nothing in eye-shot of the hotel in terms of restaurants, bars, shopping. A 10 minute walk gets you to a nearby mall, but you'll pay $30-$40 for a cab to either Santa Monica or the Walk of Fame Area.

Reviews.Title: “Great management, great people”
Reviews.Author: bbloom51
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are a little dated and the fitness room is inadequate, this is a very well managed property with an incredibly friendly and efficient group of employees. I stay in this hotel 2-3 nights per month. The rooms are always spotless. The beds are very comfortable and the hotel is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Property”
Reviews.Author: mugs3446
Reviews.Content: From the minute we checked our car with the valet to check-out, our stay at this Courtyard was perfect. The friendliness of the staff, cleanliness of the property, convenient location and a bed of pure sleeping comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: princessdar
Reviews.Content: All employees were professional and very helpful!! Everyone one was polite and the customer service was outstanding!! We have not received this type of service in a very long time. Would also like to compliment the maid service. They were very accommodating and did an outstanding job. Thank you again for making our vacation a wonderful experience. We would stay here again and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique style hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: bahamadog
Reviews.Content: Booked one night and ended up staying three. Even though the valet/parking charge seemed high, it was worth it. The staff in the valet department were friendly and very timely with retrieving my car. The Hotel was very convenient to a fantastic shopping centre and nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “This is a location I'd stay at anytime in this area!”
Reviews.Author: MarvinPolo
Reviews.Content: The people from valet and the front desk were outstanding, professional and friendly. My only small issue was housekeeping service walked in (no notice) on me twice even with the DO NOT DISTURB hanging clearly on the door. I asked and received a late checkout by an hour. There should be some way to tell housekeeping that so they will stop walking in on guests. They knocked 3 times and just walked in twice! But other than that, It was a beautiful experience and I do plan on staying there again! Thanks Marriott you are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nanaluv
Reviews.Content: I stayed because my grandson is at cedar Sinai. The hotel staff is amazing. The parking attendants are the best. They knew my name, asked about my grandson, and quickly retrieved my car. The front desk was accomadating for every request I made. I made several! I really appreciate this hotel's staff for the service I received. The room was nice and the bed was comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and value!”
Reviews.Author: ChiSpartyDemon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week-long conf for work. From the person registering me in to the garage guys helping me leave - everyone was friendly and attentive. Very happy with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very well kept hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAW2011
Reviews.Content: We were on vacation with my teenage sons and grandson. We had adjoining rooms and they were well kept and very welcoming. We even had a bottle of water and granola bars waiting for us in the rooms. The boys enjoyed hangin out at the hot tub late that evening and liked the accessiblity from the room. The staff was very friendly and helpful with directions to specific locations. Though we were not accustomed to paying for parking, we were pleased with the attendants and thier friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Appreciation”
Reviews.Author: jamienewmexico
Reviews.Content: This past weekend we stayed at the hotel while visiting LA for a large family get together. On Saturday night, my daughter was injured and could not put any weight on her leg. The hotel lent us a wheelchair Saturday night and all day Sunday, even allowing us to take the wheelchair with us to other locations. Our trip would have been greatly altered had we not been allowed to use the wheelchair. The men who helped us with our car in the garage were wonderful and so attentive. They were great before my daughters accident and even more helpful after in assisting her in and out of the car. We have stayed here many times over the past 15 years and generally the hotel is convenient to everything in the area. The front desk staff is usually helpful (although the girl who checked us in this time was confused and did not give us a bag of goodies that had been left by our family hostess). Overall, we enjoy the hotel and truly appreciated the personal attention we got by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Right place, right time!”
Reviews.Author: School_2010_09
Reviews.Content: I absolutely enjoyed my stay here. The hotel met all my needs and the staff made sure that I was taking care of during my stay. The customer service was outstanding, reminded me of where I'm from (Houston, TX). Had a touch of southern hospitality! Lastly, the location was right on! Away from all the congestion, street traffic!

Reviews.Title: “good location - closed to Century City and Westwood”
Reviews.Author: travelermk2011
Reviews.Content: Room was nice, clean and updated. They make you valet park and the valet was extremely nice, courteous and friendly. The room had small refrigerator, a coffee maker and microwave. We did not use them but it would be very nice to have these items for an extended stay. There was courtesy coffee and tea in the lobby. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location near Beverly Hills without the price tag”
Reviews.Author: Luvs2Crooze
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property due to its proximity to the Pantages Theater to see a play. It was very close to not only the theater, but to Rodeo Dr,, restaurant row, shopping and other sights. Timmy, the valet was very helpful in giving us tips for how to get to our destination and where to eat for breakfast. Everyone was friendly and inviting. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent quality of a Marriott chain, service of a "Beverly Hills" hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holtel1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything I come to expect from a Courtyard/Marrott chain hotel. The piece that stood out to me was the valet parking service; they were outstanding! Location is nicely situated with easy access to interstates, Beverly Hills, Century City and a quick drive to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: JRH1967
Reviews.Content: The quality of the food in room service was poor. The wireless internet was so slow, I could not utilize it, the room was very noisy all night long. I had a similar experience when I stayed in November, but I am a loyal type of customer so I gave it another try. I have since being staying at another Marriott

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: dogfite
Reviews.Content: This is by far my favorite Courtyard - I've stayed here at least 10 times over the last year. The hotel is immaculate and the staff is very attentive and friendly....in fact, the valet remembers me every time I arrive and I tend to have a couple of months between each visit. There truly isn't a better value for your money. You're walking distance from great shopping and dining and a short car ride from Rodeo Drive....enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “good intentions”
Reviews.Author: deso_boy
Reviews.Content: nice enough to look at, nice staff, good car park facilities BUT so noisy, on West Olympic Bvd Elevator (1 only) was so slow toilets did not flush properly - takes 2 - 3 attempts to rid it of "evidence"

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel...”
Reviews.Author: 5starkellie
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems pretty new or recently renovated. It is conveniently located near UCLA. The lobby, bar and breakfast area were all welcoming and "hip" , the staff were all very nice and accomodating. The breakfast omelette we ordered was excellent and arrived on time. Meal and drink prices were reasonable, to go sandwiches available as well. The room was beautifully decorated, perhaps on the smallish side but plenty large enough for two. A very nice little find!

Reviews.Title: “Staff is extremely attentive. rooms are clean, but small.”
Reviews.Author: JACKMCKINNEY1
Reviews.Content: . on businee in Century City. the hotel is close by. the staff service was very accomodating to our business needs and treated us with courtesy and friendship. the bathrooms are small with the sink outside the restroom facility. otherwise, the rooms are moderen, well maintained and have good appliances . including a large flat screen television.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful front desk staff makes bland hotel stand out”
Reviews.Author: travelingaussie0
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel itself has no personality, it is functional and easy to reach everywhere from by car. What it lacks in charm is more than compensated for by the helpful front desk staff. Maps to our various destinations were printed off and restaurant suggestions made quickly and efficiently. And always with a smile!The valets, restaurant and housekeeping staff were all very friendly as well. As breakfast was not included in our rate we bought food across the road at Ralph's supermarket (at the receptionist's advice)and the restaurant was happy to supply us with crockery and cutlery daily so we could eat in the room. Cheap and fresh alternative to greasy restaurant breakfasts common in USA. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another predictably pleasant stay at a Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: rsm2011
Reviews.Content: I've come to rely on consistency and comfort when staying at Marriott properties - this one being no exception. The rooms were clean, well lit and the beds always wonderfully comfortable. You won't find much in the way of views here, but that's really not the purpose of this property. It is nicely located to provide access to a wide variety of areas in and around LA. For the business traveler, you will be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced and the Beverly Hills Courtyard Marriott is a definite winner in our book.”
Reviews.Author: TomRoberts_CA
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Beverly Hills Courtyard Marriott and found the Hotel to be very clean with a very friendly, attentive and well trained staff. The room appointments are modern, comfortable and quiet. Our room looked directly at a wall of green trees and plants which allowed us to keep the drapes open during the day and at night with complete privacy. We expect a high standard when we stay at an upscale hotel and were not disappointed with the Beverly Hills Courtyard Marriott. This being said, I would like to point out a few things they did that my wife and I considered exceptional. We used valet parking and found the access to our car very convenient. The friendliness of the door man was remarkably. It was also pleasant to have the bell boy remember our names and car location from memory each time we retrieved our car. The normal hotel room service breakfast is an adventure into mediocrity. We ordered their vegetable fritters and found them to be as good as the best fritters we have ever had at a restaurant and definitely our best room service breakfast. Over the holidays we accidently left an envelope containing a great deal of cash in our room. Within an hour after checking out, the General Manager personally called us to let us know we had left the cash in the room. When we missed his first cell phone call, the General Manager sent us an email stating that we had the envelope waiting for us to pick up.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms with very outdated air conditioning system”
Reviews.Author: pilot12
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed by this Marriott Hotel. Felt more like a motel with a very old outdated and very noisy on the wall air conditioning unit. I will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Softest linens I've ever had in a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MryhrrS
Reviews.Content: Entire staff was very warm and very helpful. Room was very clean, I used to be a director of housekeeping at a 5 diamond hotel so I always inspect my room.... It was spotless. Also the linens were very soft, wish I could of brought them home with me.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: AudreyLIM1966
Reviews.Content: First of all is a NON-Smoking hotel which my family would prefer. Staffs were helpful and understanding. Walking distance to Westfield Mall and opposite the hotel there is a supermarket. Most important, the hotel is clean and safe!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Angei22
Reviews.Content: I really love this hotel. The beds and rooms are so comfortable, very quiet and relaxed. The service here has been absolutely excellent. Usually I don't like to valet my car because I feel obligated to tip, it's inconvenient, you have to wait etc. The valet parking staff here is some of the best I have ever seen. I love it. They are extremely friendly and considerate, get your car for you very quickly and always in a great mood. I also like that they don't hang around waiting for or expecting tips. Today, I had to flag a guy to come back so I could tip him! They have also been known to ask if they can throw away trash in my cupholders. Superior! My only suggestion for this hotel is to update their lamps so that you can plug in your phone charger next to the bed, as it is you have to move the mattress to plug in behind the bed. Beds are very comfy and they have rooms with little patios on the first floor that I just love. I have eaten at the restaurant once and it was pretty good. It's my favorite place to stay in Los Angeles while I'm on business.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect setting for business travel”
Reviews.Author: KMRM53
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Not only is the location ideal (easy to get to and from the airport, as well as access to places around the city and area), the rooms are always comfortable and the staff go out of their way to be helpful and friendly. When I am visiting LA, I always stay here and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “~Diamond in the Rough~”
Reviews.Author: royalkay
Reviews.Content: Hi, Future Guest I travel to california often and I've stayed at numberous hotels in Beverly Hills,Downtown La & Hollywood. I must staying in some of the 4star rated hotels didn't come close to this hotel's hospitality,knowledgable staff,Amazing valet service and room well maintainced. This hotel is nestled in the heart of beverly hills only minutes from Rodeo dr. If you don't like the noise from the street ask for a room facing other direction. If you want to experience a luxury,enjoyable stay at an unbelievable price, this is it! I cant say enough about the Amazing staff, you must Experience for yourself......

Reviews.Title: “An extremely hospitable staff makes the visit most enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: strovem
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times and keep coming back because everyone is extremely friendly and helpful. The price is reasonable,

Reviews.Title: “Too loud.”
Reviews.Author: kjh0245
Reviews.Content: 80% of the rooms face a busy street. Harley Davidson motorcycles and dump trucks roaring by late in the evening and at 5:00am. I was woke up by the traffic sounds early in the morning. Also, colleagues were not accepted for a one night stay so had to stay elsewhere requiring me to drive to two other hotels to pick them up for meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spacious, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: catsar50
Reviews.Content: Excellent parking staff, courteous and helpful in meeting in/out demands. Room was generous however showing signs of wear, ie torn carpet and torn swivel chair at desk (rm 327). Always greeted with a smile by front desk staff. Location is very convenient and accessible to UCLA.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: bosoxfans6
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the reasonable price and the fact that it was just a couple of miles from UCLA campus. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly. The parking was easy. I requested a room in the back when I read reviews about it being on a noisy street and we heard no noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: NailCandy
Reviews.Content: this hotel is GREAT!!!!!....the location is amazing, ur close to everything...Santa Monica, DT, Venice Beach and more...i took the bus everywhere and the people at the front desk went above and beyond to help me with the bus routes!....the rooms were clean and it was just really nice to stay here....the Wesfield Mall is like 7-10mins away from the hotel and Ralphs grocery story is literally across the street....the next time i'm in LA i'll be staying here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Property, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: LGAflyer
Reviews.Content: It's a Courtyard. Pretty standard (in a good way). The staff here was particularly helpful. Noisy crowd next door, and since I heard kids, I just decided to change rooms rather than hope they might quiet down. Front desk was as flexible as they could be. Also, when I opted for street parking, they helpfully told me to carefully read all the signs (as I would've anyway, but it was nice they were watching out for their guests).

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: nitesweatz
Reviews.Content: I was visiting a friend at UCLA hospital for a few days. I was not disappointed in any way by the folks at the Marriott. As always, clean, comfortable, quite and friendly! Thanks~ Lesley Hatfield

Reviews.Title: “Great Welcome, familiar faces and smiles, a great way to travel.”
Reviews.Author: paule_thonon
Reviews.Content: A little note to say that we stay at the Courtyard Marriott twice a year to come and visit my family in LA. Travelling from Paris to LA is quite a long trip but to be welcomed by familiar faces at the Courtyard Marriott for the past ten years if it is not more, is quite a treat. My children love the hotel and they especially love cookies and tea that the hotel offers to their clients. Bravo to the whole team and keep up the good work. Our next trip in from the 22nd - 31st Oct 2010 Paule, Mathieu and Julia THONON

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samy145
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, we were travelling with family so chose this hotel just coz of the room size and they had confirmed the interconnecting room well in advance which was great and I donâ€™t understand why most of the hotels donâ€™t confirm it in advance, anyways would highly recommend this hotel for the peace and the lovely location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you want to hang out in Beverly Hills and Westwood”
Reviews.Author: sgarabedian
Reviews.Content: We spent one night there for a short getaway. It was in a good location, somewhat in between Beverly Hills and Westwood area. Parking was easy and not very expensive, relatively speaking. Our room had a queen sized bed, seemed a bit small, but large enough for our purposes. Everything was very clean. Service was fast, courteous, and efficient. There is a Ralphs supermarket right across the street which was convenient. Would stay again. As a Marriott Elite member, they recognized me by having two bottles of water and two Snickers bars sitting on the table with a short welcoming note. I thought that was very very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: golferfan
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of their way to make sure I felt welcome, including the valet team. All the employees from housekeepers and restaurant staff were friendly and you could tell they liked their jobs. Courtyard is a great brand and the microwaves and fridges in the room is a nice plus. Having an in room safe would be one suggestion. I thought the noise from Olympic might be a problem but the rooms have good soundproofing. Overall, great hotel, I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “VERY POOR INTERNET SPEED”
Reviews.Author: hanjaLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: If you are a business person and need to get work done after hours in your room, this is not place to stay. While the internet access is free, you get what you pay for. I'd much rather pay $10 per day and get internet service I can use. Worse yet, if you ask the staff if they can do anything about it, they stare you like you have seven heads -- I got nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not best location”
Reviews.Author: TravelgalCathy
Reviews.Content: The pros: clean, well appointed room, good value, helpful staff. The cons: not walking distance to much except grocery store across the street. Good place to put your head down if you are okay having to drive everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “I Had A Wonderful Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KylieMinogueFan10
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott Century City Beverly Hills and we had a wonderful stay! it is near Santa Monica, Venice, Beverly Hills, Hollywood, Downtown LA, and there a fabulous mall (Westfield Century City) just 10 minutes away walking distance!!! The staff was super friendly, specially the front desk! the rooms were clean and everything worked in perfect order. I would most definitively go back for more I enjoy my stay at this place!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, good location, decent for weekend priceline”
Reviews.Author: PlannerGeek
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel via Priceline (3*, $70). Location is reasonably convenient, ~20 min from LAX, Santa Monica, Hollywood. Hotel is OK, average Courtyard, smallish rooms, but fine for a weekend. Can be a little noisy (Olympic is a busy street). Not much in the immediate vicinity, you'd need a car probably to stay here. Tip- Parking is $15 at the hotel -- there is a limited number of parking spaces behind the Ralph's grocery store across Olympic -- watch the signs carefully, because most of the spaces require permits for overnight parking, but there are a few.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: stclarapet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while my dad was at Cedars-Sinai. Great location for value. Given several restaurant recommendations; enjoyed walking to good restaurant at Westfield Century City shopping center. Ralph's market across the street if you wanted to use the microwave and refrigerator in the room. Room on second floor facing Olympic Blvd. First night, I heard road noise, second night I turned the fan only on the window heating/air unit and used it as "white noise". Room was very clean, had all amenities. Two double beds, room large enough for desk and lounge chair at end of room to sit and read in. Thought breakfast buffet was good for the price ($12.99), had both hot and cold choices. Valet parking $15/day. By far the most stellar thing about this hotel is the staff. Everyone from the valet to housekeeping to front desk is the most pleasant, helpful staff at any hotel I have stayed in. The valets are quick, didn't mind my several trips in and out each day, and even had a big smile and good morning at 4:45 am. I managed to leave behind both my cell phone charger and laptop computer and the staff kept them safe and returned them to me quickly in the mailers I provided. In the course of arranging the return of my items, I spoke several times to the front desk, not always getting the same person. Every person I spoke to was clued in to my situation. I didn't have to start over and explain my story each time. I think that is exceptional staffing communication.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: VacationQueen24
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1.) Nice hotel 2.) Great location (so close to Rodeo Drive, Beverly Center and all sorts of stuff) 3.) Valet parking is only $11 (great compared to the $20 parking fees hotels in West Hollywood/Beverly Hills charge) 4.) Friendly staff - everyone was so eager to help, from the valet guy to the housekeeper (and they're fast, too!) 5.) Free wi-fi! Cons: 1.) Elevator was slow (and they don't have a service elevator, which explains why the elevator was always so crowded) 2.) Only king bed or double beds (no queen beds) 3.) Only two computers in the business center - one reserved for printing boarding passes only (but then again with free wi-fi all over the property, who needs a business center?)

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable for a 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: alexsndiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Courtyard for only 1 night. The hotel is clean and comfortable. We had a bedroom on the 4th floor facing Olympic Blvd. Yes, the road noise could be a problem if you are lower down. On the 4th floor, the road noise was not bad. Bed was comfortable. TV was a flat screen with NO HDTV channels. Room had a small frig and microwave. Room had a noisy a/c unit. It was one of those old "window" models not the a quiet centralized a/c unit. I woke up a couple times because the a/c kept going on and off. Bathroom was clean. Sink was a little low and we were NOT in an ADA room either. So keep this in mind. $15 for valet. The Courtyard was fine for our purposes but I wont not recommend this place to anyone staying long term or on a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Close to most LA attractions.”
Reviews.Author: CopaSis
Reviews.Content: Fast check in. Friendly staff (everyone says hello to you). Valet is $15 per day with in and out privileges. Breakfast available, but not worth the price. Air conditioning would kick on and off......and room got very warm. Shared balcony was a bit odd and didn't give you a secure feeling. Internet was VERY slow.

Reviews.Title: “The most helpful staff that one may experience”
Reviews.Author: drasel
Reviews.Content: This is a very well run and managed hotel in the area adjacent to Beverly Hills. The staff at the front desk is amazing and very helpful in all aspects of one's stay. We spent 6 nights in this hotel and were quite happy with our stay. After reading several earlier reviews of the property and knowing how busy and noisy Olympic Blvd can get, I called prior to arrival and requested a quiet room facing the backyard. The room we got was extremely quiet, clean, with a flat screen LCD TV and new carpet. When we mentioned that an infant is staying with us, we were offered a crib to be brought to our room without even mentioning it. I believe that the name of the person at the front desk was Marco. The rest of the front desk staff was as helpful. The recommended restaurants were just as good as the girls at the front desk described them. Although there is no full kitchenette in the room, there is a good size refrigerator and a microwave in each room, with a great Ralph's Grocery story literally across the street from the hotel. We would definitely return back to stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly staff, delicious pancakes!”
Reviews.Author: lizSiouxFalls_SD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small but very nice. The staff were all super nice and helpful. They have free internet access with printers in the lobby. I had the restaurant's pancakes and bacon one morning and the meal was wonderful, as was the service. The rooms were very nice. The only thing that needed improvement was to clean the bathrooms a little more thoroughly from dust build up--nothing gross just something I keep up at home so they should, too. This hotel recycles! The location is excellent. They are right across the street from a very nice grocery store, Ralph's, just don't buy their pastries--blah. Plus the hotel is down the street a couple blocks from a very nice outdoor mall. Visit Breadbar for their croissants and RockSugar for their ginger margaritas!! I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Courtyard - but...”
Reviews.Author: beachbobe
Reviews.Content: missing a pool (spa only) and LIGHT SLEEPER alert - make sure to ask for a room "in the back". Rooms facing West Olympic basically overlook a very busy city street. Very courteous front desk - $15 valet parking only. 5-10 min walk to Westfield mall and across the street from Ralph's grocery. Standard buffet breakfast and light dinner available.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: traveler99Michigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. The hotel is clean and decor attractive, but nothing really works in this hotel. The rooms are small, oddly configured and overfurnished. Not only is it on a busy street with much traffic noise, but it borders on the south end of Century City and a residential neighborhood, so unlike many other places in Los Angeles, the only thing within walking distance is the grocery store across the street. I would stay in Beverly Hills or West Los Angeles closer to Santa Monica if returning, you would be no further from the major sights in the area and there are restaurants and amenities near those hotels. The staff at the Courtyard are disorganized and give out conflicting messages; they proved to be minimally helpful at best for simple requests. I definitely would not stay here with any expectations beyond a basic night's sleep at a moderately premium price.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: peppermint23
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week while touring Los Angeles, and this hotel was very nice for a simple stay. The staff was helpful, rooms were clean and comfortable with nice beds and balconies that drowned out the highway, breakfast was fine. The parking was great since the garage is small and convenient and valet isn't necessary. I would book this hotel if traveling with family in a small group, alone or with a few friends. I liked its simplicity and attractive qualities that Courtyards tend to provide. Very close to LAX and the Century City mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: kmiley6294
Reviews.Content: Staff was excellent. Room was nice and clean. Disappointed that there was no pool only spa. Used the workout room which was adequate - no free weights. The only downside was it was a bear to get out of......on a really busy street!

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better..Could Be Worse....”
Reviews.Author: pulgadelmundo
Reviews.Content: Hi Everyone..so many hotels to write about..so little time.. My girlfriend who travels booked her stay the same day as arrival. Let me break down the pros and cons...169 dollars plus tax for a double room..She later moved to a 2 room suite for 225 a night.. but sometimes this rate is not availiable... Cons: Parking: Parking around the Hotel is PERMIT ONLY...so 15 bucks a day is not THAT bad in LA or at the location but of course it sucks it you have visitors...Most other places down by Pico/Beverly charge 22 a day. There is a Ralphs across the way that you can try and park at BUT as the hotel's valet put it "at rush hour it is harder to cross then the Mexican Border into the USA". I also didn't want to park on the Ralph's top level becuase there was some homeless guy dancing at 1am..If you park at Ralph's go for the lower/covered parking area near the Holiday Inn Express... The Lobby is Super Small but they do offer free coffee which saves you a trip to starbucks if you grab some ice from the machine to make it ICED....Also if you want a more discreet hotel this one is tough becuase there always seem to be lots of workers around.. Rooms: Small, clean but nothing special..small bathroom...Sadly, I wasn't really even impressed by the 2 room Suite. I have had better suite stays at Comfort Suites.. Pro: Solid Location...down the street from Beverly Hills, near a Westfield shopping Center and close to West LA.. The problem with LA hotels is either they are super crazy expensive or they are expensive and ok or they are cheap and scary...Vegas this is not :) It is really hard to find a decent ok hotel on the Westside...LAX hotels generally creepy/smoky pits due to their nomad crowd

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is ok”
Reviews.Author: bogie27
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the courtyard in Century City/Beverly Hills for 1 night. Pros: *it's in the heart of Beverly Hills; not far from lots of shopping and restaurants if that's your thing; *only 4 miles from the walk of fame and rodeo drive *very, very reasonably priced for being in beverly hills *very close to the santa monica freeway Cons: *because it's so reasonably priced, the hotel rooms aren't extravagent, but they are ok *valet parking is $15/day, no exceptions *if you're not used to LA restaurants prices, you're in for a shock! * the property and grounds are ok, but again, you're i the heart of beverly hills at a reasonably priced hotel, so do expect spectacular landscaping and big pool; the view out of our window was that of a retaining wall; the rooms towards the back of the property had a view of the courtyard Overall, i'd say this hotel is just right and i would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mills38017
Reviews.Content: We had such a fantastic stay at this hotel. It was clean and nicely decorated. The hotel has a restaurant and a small market to purchase snacks. Located in the Century City/Beverly Hills area, it is in a safe location that was a great starting point for virtually anywhere in the city. What pleased me most about this hotel was the wonderful valet. Valet parking here was only $15 dollars a day, much cheaper than many other hotels, and the valet gentlemen could not have been nicer. They kindly and courteously spent time going over maps with us to help us find the best routes for travel. They quickly brought our vehicle to us and courteously opened doors. When we would leave the hotel, they knew us by name also. What a pleasure it was for us to get such a helpful team of people from a hotel that only cost us $200 a night. The service there rivaled much more expensive accommodations we have experienced elsewhere. We have nothing but high praise for this hotel. We would definitely stay here again, and feel that we had great location, excellent service and fair price all rolled into one at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere unless you're stuck”
Reviews.Author: tareus1849
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights because it was close to a function I was attending. First, the hotel is located on a busy street and traffic continues throughout the night. I needed earplugs to sleep. I'm not sure whether there are rooms located off the street, but it would be worthwhile checking into this possibility. Second, there's not much located close by. I arrived in the evening and could not find a place to eat in walking distance. The tiny bar in the hotel has a limited menu and I had to settle for that. Third, I discovered three bugs in my linen, which is a good enough reason for me never to return. Surprising given that the room was generally clean and has all the typical amenities - coffee, TV, wireless, etc - one associates with the chain. The buffet breakfast was fine. Main desk service was slow. All in all, though cheap for L.A., it was still too way expensive for what it was. I can't imagine why anybody would truly desire to return to such a place, inoffensive though it may be.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: ponderous
Reviews.Content: for nearly $200/night, i'd expect a lot of services to be included--but we had to pay $15/day for parking, $13/person for a so-so breakfast buffet, $7/visit room service charges, and more. guess that's los angeles for ya. the room was clean and attractive, and the beds were comfortable, but it wasn't anything astonishing. our bathroom got ridiculously warm and humid (4 people showering daily can do that, i guess) and leaving the door open and the fan on didn't help. the jacuzzi was relaxing, but we were kicked out of it at midnight once (fair enough considering the 10pm closing time). staff is pretty friendly and willing to help out. the location is decent, though more stuff could be within walking distance (the ralph's across the street was a lifesaver in comparison to the overpriced hotel food!). overall, i would have expected more for what we were paying, but i don't have too many complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: kironb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three evenings in mid-July for business in a king non-smoking. The Good: + Large LCD TV in the room along with a reasonable microwave and fridge + Walking distance from the Westfield Century City open air shopping center and across the road from the Ralphs Fresh Fare supermarket + Free wired Internet access in room + Free Seattle's Best coffee in the lobby + Hotel room & bathroom was clean and reasonably sized The Bad: + Air conditioning unit was one of those old baseboard style ones and was very noisy + Hotel did not calculate my bill correctly, and I had to follow up after my return home + AAA cost was close to $200/night - a bit high given the facility, but might have been location driven The Ugly: + Fitness room could use an update to its one Universal Gym piece of equipment + No on-site room service. Hotel offers buffet breakfast ($12.99) and after 5 snacks (paid) but no other food possibilities

Reviews.Title: “Decent Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Shineykate
Reviews.Content: I liked the location of this property - not within walking distance of much. Neat and clean, no frills...overpriced breakfast. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Courtyard EVER!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerOrlando
Reviews.Content: After being reassured a recent renovation cured the many problems (smelly bathrooms, stained carpeting, LOUSY service (front desk and room service), and noisy rooms) that plagued this hotel, I made the mistake of giving them another chance. WRONG thing to do! Service is still horrid! I waited 10 minutes to check-in (at 10:00 at night) while the front desk clerk, all the while smiling at me and saying "one minute", carried on a conversation with who could only be assumed as a very close boyfriend. After that I was checked in and was given the farthest room from the elevator, only to find out it had 2 double beds versus the requested king size (this is the 4th room - and last - I've booked through the Internet and all 4 have had lousy locations! Hello American Express Travel!). I called the front desk, and after no answer following the 30th ring, I went back down to the front desk to find the clerk again on her cell phone. It only took her 5 minutes this time before I was told there were no king rooms available. Room service the following night took 45 minutes â€“ for a $18 hamburger â€“ and it was COLD! The next morning I registered a complaint with someone who claimed to have been the general manager and found his response rather amusing. He basically, in so many words, said that not EVERYONE can be pleased! A very novel idea I thought, coming from a hotel manager, whose mantra is if you don't like it, I'll fix it. Riiiggghhhttt! What angered me more was that there was NO attempt made to check and see if there WAS a king size room available (I didnâ€™t mention the poor room service to him. Good thing as he probably would have told me thereâ€™s a nice Carlâ€™s Drive thru two blocks away!). I was left to feel I should be grateful I had a room at all. This was NOT the Oscar's week and the hotel looked relatively empty (I now know why!).While this is not the managerâ€™s fault, salt was poured on the wound when while waiting for my ride, a fellow guest said that this isn't bad for the location, a Courtyard, and a $79 per night rate. I was paying $229 - for a room I didn't even want! I bet SHE got my king size bed..... Needless to say, STAY AWAY from this hotel. I doubt Motel 6 would want this property to share its name!

Reviews.Title: “LESS than good”
Reviews.Author: PGore
Reviews.Content: It really puzzles me why this hotel earned the 3 star rating. And this is why: 1. The hotel is located just a foot (1) away from a busy road. Traffic noise easily travels thru the hotel's thin room windows. 2. The hotels security is lacking. Imagine getting a room key to the hotel room that is already occupied by someone else. This is what happened to us when we walked-in on an unsuspecting man resting in his red underwear on bed. 3. The hotel staff is untrained and unprofessional. For example, we were greeted by "Whatz Up?"

Reviews.Title: “Totally fine, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: lindymae
Reviews.Content: The remodeling that was mentioned in previous reviews is completed and the hotel looks very nice. New furniture, fixtures, carpet, etc. Each room has a microwave and fridge. Keep in mind they don't have pool. Might be a disappointment for a vacationing family. Our room was big enough for my husband and I, but I wouldn't want to be traveling with a family of four in this size room. Avoid room 335 the noise from the elevator (not people getting on the elevator, but the actually mechanism is really loud. Might be the same for 235 too.) It's in an unremarkable, but safe location. Mostly office buildings and neighborhood, plus it's on a very busy street. Probably great if you are doing business at one of the networks. There is no free breakfast. I find this odd when lesser, cheaper Marriotts do. They serve a $10 breakfast which looked adequate, but we opted to cross the street and grab a microwaveable breakfast at the Ralph's grocery store. Got two breakfast burritos, yogurts and an apple for $3. There are no restaurants within walking distance, but the Ralph's is a "Fresh Faire" which is Ralph's more "gourmet" kind of grocery store. You could feed yourself well over there, plus they have a nice wine selection. When you arrive, unload your car at the lobby level because there is no elevator to the garage. Odd. The staff was incredibly nice and professional - almost like they were working at a nicer hotel than they are. There is a computer in the lobby (they call it their "business center") with a printer. Plus free high speed in the rooms (not wireless).

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here For Now”
Reviews.Author: busy_traveler
Reviews.Content: Be aware that the hotel is undergoing extensive renovation and that there is no special consideration given for the guests, except that the check in staff wear silly hard hats. They'll still charge you rack rates, and you have to step around the work men that work during the day. There dust and debris on your way to your room (and it follows you). There are no signs telling where the safe areas from the construction areas are (OSHA violation???)Valet/self parking is $15/day regardless.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard Los Angeles Century City / Beverly Hills
HotelInfo.Address: 10320 West Olympic Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90064
